description: Delete one or more measurement objects. By default, all measurement objects are deleted. A range can be specified to restrict the operation to select objects, allowing targeted deletion based on measurement ID or other criteria.
notes: Default behavior: deletes ALL measurement objects if no range specified
Use range to selectively delete specific measurements
Common range: 'range id <i>' to delete measurement with specific ID
Can delete multiple measurements with range specification
Deleted measurements cannot be recovered - must recreate with measure create
After deletion, measurement ID becomes available for reuse
No confirmation prompt - deletion is immediate
Safe to delete non-existent measurement ID (no error)

examples.description: Delete all measurement objects in the model
Delete only measurement object with ID 1
examples.use_case: Remove specific measurement while keeping others

examples.description: Delete measurement objects with IDs from 2 to 5 (inclusive)

examples.command:
measure create radius 0.5
measure create radius 0.5
measure create radius 0.5
measure delete range id 1
measure delete
examples.description: Create 3 measurements, delete ID 1, then delete remaining
examples.use_case: Example from documentation showing selective and complete deletion

examples.command:
measure list
measure delete range id 3
measure list
examples.description: List measurements, delete one, list again to verify

notes: Python SDK likely has measure deletion methods in itasca.measure module
Command interface provides simpler syntax for deletion operations
Exact Python method signatures - consult PFC Python documentation

command_vs_python.python:
# Python SDK approach - consult PFC documentation for exact syntax
# itasca.measure module provides deletion functionality

common_use_cases.use_case: Remove specific measurement after analysis complete
workflow: 1. Create and use measurement: measure create id 5 radius 3.0
2. Perform analysis: model clean, query results
3. No longer needed: measure delete range id 5
4. Measurement removed, ID 5 available for reuse
common_use_cases.notes: Keeps model clean by removing unused measurements

common_use_cases.use_case: Reset all measurements between simulation phases
workflow: 3. Phase 2: Create new measurements with different configurations

common_use_cases.use_case: Replace specific measurement with updated configuration
workflow: 1. Original measurement: measure create id 1 radius 2.0
2. Need different radius: measure delete range id 1
common_use_cases.notes: Sometimes easier to delete and recreate than modify

workflow: 1. Model has temporary measurements from analysis
4. Saved model doesn't include temporary measurements
common_use_cases.notes: Reduce saved model size by removing analysis artifacts

typical_workflow: 1. Identify measurements to delete: measure list
2. Delete specific measurement: measure delete range id <i>

delete_all.warning: No confirmation - all measurements deleted immediately

when_to_use: Remove specific measurement while keeping others
Replace one measurement with updated version
Incrementally clean up as analysis progresses
Precise control over which measurements exist

range_specifications.description: Common range specifications for measure delete

id_range.effect: Delete measurements with IDs from <i1> to <i2> (inclusive)

deletion_permanence.description: What happens when measurements are deleted
deletion_permanence.immediate_effect: Measurement object removed from model immediately
deletion_permanence.no_undo: Cannot undo deletion - must recreate with measure create
deletion_permanence.id_reuse: Deleted ID becomes available for new measurements
deletion_permanence.data_loss: All measurement data (porosity, stress, etc.) lost
deletion_permanence.history_cleared: Any measurement history associated with deleted measurement is lost
deletion_permanence.recommendation: Export important data with measure dump before deleting

warnings.message: measure delete executes immediately without confirmation prompt
warnings.mitigation: Double-check before deleting, especially 'measure delete' (all measurements)

warnings.message: Deleted measurements cannot be recovered - must recreate
warnings.mitigation: Export measurement data before deletion if needed later

warnings.message: Omitting range deletes ALL measurements, not zero measurements
warnings.mitigation: Always specify range if you want selective deletion

warnings.message: All measurement calculations (porosity, stress, etc.) lost on deletion
warnings.mitigation: Use measure dump to export data before deletion if needed

solutions: No undo - must recreate measurements with measure create
If data needed, check if measurement dump or history was saved
Lesson: use 'range id' for selective deletion
Consider saving model state before bulk deletions

troubleshooting.issue: Trying to delete non-existent measurement ID
solutions: Usually no error - command succeeds silently
Use measure list to check which IDs exist
Not typically a problem unless expecting specific side effects
Check if measure dump output was saved
Check if measurement history was recorded
Must recreate measurement and recalculate (model clean)

troubleshooting.issue: Want to modify measurement instead of delete/recreate
solutions: measure modify can change radius, position, tolerance, etc.
Only delete if modification not sufficient
Delete/recreate useful when changing fundamental properties

performance_considerations.deletion_cost: Very fast - O(1) or O(n) for small n
performance_considerations.memory_freed: Memory used by measurement object freed
performance_considerations.impact: Negligible performance impact even for many measurements

delete_vs_modify.recommendation: Use modify when possible; delete only when measurement no longer needed

id_reuse_after_deletion.description: What happens to measurement IDs after deletion
id_reuse_after_deletion.can_reuse: Can create new measurement with same ID
id_reuse_after_deletion.no_automatic_reuse: Auto-assigned IDs may not reuse freed IDs immediately
id_reuse_after_deletion.explicit_reuse: Use 'measure create id <deleted_id>' to explicitly reuse
id_reuse_after_deletion.example: measure delete range id 5, then measure create id 5 radius 3.0

good_reasons: Analysis complete, measurement no longer needed
Want to replace with different configuration
Freeing memory (though measurements use little memory)
poor_reasons: Want to change measurement parameters (use modify instead)
Temporary disable measurement (no disable feature, but can recreate easily)
Thinking deletion is required before modification (it's not)

delete_all.use: Most efficient for removing all measurements
